info.description: Backend service for Mia-Platform catalog and marketplace
info.title: Catalog service

software-catalog-category.title: Software Catalog category
software-catalog-category.description: A category to cluster items of the Software Catalog.

categoryId.description: The unique identifier of the category.

label.description: A human-readable label for the category.

software-catalog-item-manifest.title: Software Catalog item manifest
software-catalog-item-manifest.description: The data needed to apply a single version of a Software Catalog item.

annotations.description: An unstructured key value map that may be set by external tools to store and retrieve arbitrary metadata. They are not queryable and should be preserved when modifying this object.

categoryId.description: The unique identifier of this item's version's category.

description.description: A brief description of this item.

documentation.description: A reference to the documentation regarding this item.

url.description: The URL where to reach for the documentation.

imageUrl.description: The URL of the image associated with this item.

itemId.description: A string that, alongside with `.version.name`, uniquely identifies this item within its namespace (`.tenantId`). Read-only.

itemTypeDefinitionRef.description: The reference to an Item Type Definition in the form of its composite primary key. Read-only.

name.description: The name of the Item Type Definition (references its `.metadata.name`).

namespace.description: The identifier of the Item Type Definition namespace (references its `.metadata.namespace.id`).

labels.description: A map of string keys and values that can be used to organize and categorize (scope and select) objects.

lifecycleStatus.description: The lifecycle status of this item.

url.description: The URL in standard URI format.

displayName.description: A user-friendly title for the link.

maintainers.description: A list of organizational entities maintaining this object.

name.description: The display name of the maintainer.

email.description: A contact email of the maintainer.

name.description: The human-readable title of this item.

providerId.description: The identifier of the provider used to retrieve markdown documentation content and external resources, if supported by the item's type.

relationships.description: A list of relationships from this item to any other entity (either part of the Software Catalog or not).

target.description: The receiving end of the relationships. It can be a URN-reference to another Software Catalog entity or an arbitrary string.

type.description: The type of the relationships. It can be one of the Software Catalog well-known relationships or an arbitrary string.

releaseDate.description: The time when this item was published.

repositoryUrl.description: The URL of the repository containing the source code of the resource(s) created by this item.

resources.description: The representation of the resource(s) that will be created starting from this item. It should be validated through the matching Item Type Definition.

supportedBy.description: The identifier of the company that has produced this item.

supportedByImageUrl.description: The URL of the image associated with the company that has produced this item.

tenantId.description: The identifier of the tenant to which this item belongs. Within this tenant, the combination of the `.name` and the `.version.name` of this item must be unique. Read-only.

type.description: The type of this item's version. Deprecated in favour of `.itemTypeDefinitionRef`. Must be set if `.itemTypeDefinitionRef` is not set, otherwise it will be ignored. Read-only.

version.description: The Semantic version of this item.

name.description: The name of this version. It should follow Semantic Versioning. Read-only.

releaseNote.description: The release note of this version. It should support Markdown.

security.description: A flag stating if this version addresses any vulnerability.

example.releaseNote:
# What's new

Here comes some new **amazing** features!

visibility.description: The visibility of this item. It can be public (i.e., visible to any user calling the APIs, even if not authenticated with the Console), "all tenants" (i.e., visible to all tenants of the Console installation), or private (i.e., only visible to the item's tenant).

allTenants.description: A flag stating whether this item's release should be visible to all tenants of the Console installation.

public.description: A flag stating whether this item's release should be visible to any user calling the APIs, even if not authenticated with the Console.

example.description: A standardized service to handle orders from an e-commerce website.
example.name: Order Service

software-catalog-item.description: A single version of a Software Catalog item.

_id.description: The MongoDB `_id` of this item's version's document.

annotations.description: An unstructured key value map that may be set by external tools to store and retrieve arbitrary metadata. They are not queryable and should be preserved when modifying this object.

category.description: The information regarding this item's version's category.

id.description: The unique identifier of the category.

label.description: The human-readable label of the category. Read-only.

componentsIds.description: A list aggregating any `sourceComponentId` declared in the `.resources.services` of this item's version. Read-only.

description.description: A brief description of this item.

documentation.description: A reference to the documentation regarding this item.

url.description: The URL where to reach for the documentation.

imageUrl.description: The URL of the image associated with this item.

isLatest.description: A flag stating if the this item is the latest release of the item.

itemId.description: A string that, alongside with `.version.name`, uniquely identifies this item within its namespace (`.tenantId`). Read-only.

itemTypeDefinitionRef.description: The reference to an Item Type Definition in the form of its composite primary key. Read-only.

name.description: The name of the Item Type Definition (references its `.metadata.name`).

namespace.description: The identifier of the Item Type Definition namespace (references its `.metadata.namespace.id`).

labels.description: A map of string keys and values that can be used to organize and categorize (scope and select) objects.

lifecycleStatus.description: The lifecycle status of this item.

url.description: The URL in standard URI format.

displayName.description: A user-friendly title for the link.

maintainers.description: A list of organizational entities maintaining this object.

name.description: The display name of the maintainer.

email.description: A contact email of the maintainer.

name.description: The human-readable title of this item.

providerId.description: The identifier of the provider used to retrieve markdown documentation content and external resources, if supported by the item's type.

relationships.description: A list of relationships from this item to any other entity (either part of the Software Catalog or not).

target.description: The receiving end of the relationships. It can be a URN-reference to another Software Catalog entity or an arbitrary string.

type.description: The type of the relationships. It can be one of the Software Catalog well-known relationships or an arbitrary string.

releaseDate.description: The time when this item was published.

repositoryUrl.description: The URL of the repository containing the source code of the resource(s) created by this item.

resources.description: The representation of the resource(s) that will be created starting from this item. It should be validated through the matching Item Type Definition.

supportedBy.description: The identifier of the company that has produced this item.

supportedByImageUrl.description: The URL of the image associated with the company that has produced this item.

tenantId.description: The identifier of the tenant to which this item belongs. Within this tenant, the combination of the `.name` and the `.version.name` of this item must be unique. Read-only.

type.description: The type of this item's version. Deprecated in favour of `.itemTypeDefinitionRef`. It must always match the `.itemTypeDefinitionRef.name` of this item. Read-only.

version.description: The Semantic version of this item.

name.description: The name of this version. It should follow Semantic Versioning. Read-only.

releaseNote.description: The release note of this version. It should support Markdown.

security.description: A flag stating if this version addresses any vulnerability.

example.releaseNote:
# What's new

Here comes some new **amazing** features!

visibility.description: The visibility of this item. It can be public (i.e., visible to any user calling the APIs, even if not authenticated with the Console), "all tenants" (i.e., visible to all tenants of the Console installation), or private (i.e., only visible to the item's tenant).

allTenants.description: A flag stating whether this item's release should be visible to all tenants of the Console installation.

public.description: A flag stating whether this item's release should be visible to any user calling the APIs, even if not authenticated with the Console.

software-catalog-item-release.title: Software Catalog item release
software-catalog-item-release.description: A single release of a Software Catalog item.

description.description: A brief description of this item.

isLatest.description: A flag stating if the this item is the latest release of the item.

lifecycleStatus.description: The lifecycle status of this item.

name.description: The human-readable title of this item.

reference.description: The reference to the item in the form of the MongoDB `_id` of the corresponding document.

releaseDate.description: The time when this item was published.

releaseNote.description: The release note of this version. It should support Markdown.

security.description: A flag stating if this version addresses any vulnerability.

version.description: The name of this version. It should follow Semantic Versioning. A fallback version `NA` is also accepted for items of types that do not support versioning, or for retro-compatibility reasons. Read-only.

visibility.description: The visibility of this item. It can be public (i.e., visible to any user calling the APIs, even if not authenticated with the Console), "all tenants" (i.e., visible to all tenants of the Console installation), or private (i.e., only visible to the item's tenant).

allTenants.description: A flag stating whether this item's release should be visible to all tenants of the Console installation.

public.description: A flag stating whether this item's release should be visible to any user calling the APIs, even if not authenticated with the Console.

version.releaseNote:
# About this version

The first release of the service ðŸŽ‰

software-catalog-item-metadata.title: Software Catalog item metadata
software-catalog-item-metadata.description: The metadata of a Software Catalog item's version.

itemId.description: A string that, alongside with `.version.name`, uniquely identifies this item within its namespace (`.tenantId`). Read-only.

tenantId.description: The identifier of the tenant to which this item belongs. Within this tenant, the combination of the `.name` and the `.version.name` of this item must be unique. Read-only.

name.description: The human-readable title of this item.

version.description: The name of this version. It should follow Semantic Versioning. A fallback version `NA` is also accepted for items of types that do not support versioning, or for retro-compatibility reasons. Read-only.

software-catalog-item-type-definition.title: Software Catalog item type definition
software-catalog-item-type-definition.description: An entity used to extend the Software Catalog beyond its built-in capabilities defining a new type of items.

apiVersion.description: The versioned schema of this representation of an object.

kind.description: The family of resources this object belongs to.

metadata.description: Descriptive properties referring to this object.

namespace.description: The namespace this object belongs to. Within this namespace, the `.metadata.name` of this object must be unique. Read-only.

scope.description: The hierarchical level of the namespace.

name.description: A string that uniquely identifies this object within its namespace (`.metadata.namespace`). Must be equal to the `.spec.type` of this object. Read-only.

visibility.description: The visibility on this object. It can be public (i.e., visible to all tenants of the Console installation), or private (i.e., only visible to the namespace this object belongs to).

scope.description: The hierarchical level at which this object is visible.
The hierarchical level at which this object is visible.

ids.description: A list of identifiers of the tenants with visibility on this object. It can contain only one item that must be equal to the `.metadata.namespace.id` of this object.

displayName.description: The human-readable title of this object. Clients may use it as the title associated with the items of the defined type. Defaults to the `.metadata.name` of this object.

description.description: A brief description of this object. Clients may use it as the description associated with the items of the defined type.

icon.description: An icon associated with this object. Clients may use it as the icon associated with the items of the defined type.

mediaType.description: The MIME type of the image.

base64Data.description: The image data encoded in Base64 format.

documentation.description: A reference to the documentation regarding this object. Clients may use it as the documentation associated with the items of the defined type.

url.description: The URL of the documentation page.

labels.description: A map of string keys and values that can be used to organize and categorize (scope and select) objects.

annotations.description: An unstructured key value map that may be set by external tools to store and retrieve arbitrary metadata. They are not queryable and should be preserved when modifying this object.

url.description: The URL in standard URI format.

displayName.description: A user-friendly title for the link.

maintainers.description: A list of organizational entities maintaining this object.

name.description: The display name of the maintainer.

email.description: A contact email of the maintainer.

name.description: The display name of the publisher.

url.description: A link to a publisher webpage.

image.description: A logo or relevant image of the publisher.

mediaType.description: The MIME type of the image.

base64Data.description: The image data encoded in Base64 format.

spec.description: The specification of the desired state of this object.

type.description: The item type defined by this object. It must match the `.metadata.name` of this object. Read-only.

scope.description: The scope where items of the defined type should be managed.

isVersioningSupported.description: A flag stating whether the items of the defined type should support versioning.

validation.description: The JSON schema against which the `.resources` of  the items of the defined type should be validated.

schema.description: The validation JSON Schema. It must be a valid JSON Schema draft 07.

controlledFields.description: A list of fields managed by the server when changing the version of an item of the defined type.

items.description: The information needed to access a specific value of the item.

jsonPath.description: The JSON path to access the item value.

key.description: The unique name of the field.

__v.description: The opaque value that represents the internal version of this object. Clients may not set this value and must treat it as opaque. Read-only.

imageName.description: The name of the Docker image (without registry or tag)

registry.description: The Docker registry hostname where the image is stored

tag.description: The tag/version of the Docker image

legacy-catalog-category.description: Data model of a Catalog category
legacy-catalog-category.title: Legacy catalog category

legacy-catalog-item-manifest.description: Data model of a Catalog item to apply

comingSoon.description: Flag that will prevent the use of the item

imageUrl.description: Url of the image associated with the item

isVersioningSupported.description: States if versioning is supported for the custom resource defined by the CRD. Applicable only for type "custom-resource-definition"

itemId.description: RFC-1035 compliant identifier of the item. It forms a composite PK with tenantId and, if present, version.name

name.description: Human-readable name of the item

providerId.description: Identifier of the provider used to retrieve markdown documentation content and external resources, if supported by the item type

publishOnMiaDocumentation.description: Flag stating if the resource documentation should be published on Mia-Platform public documentation

repositoryUrl.description: URL of the repository containing the source code of the resource created by the item

resources.description: Representation of the resource that will be created starting from this item. It could be validated through the matching CRD

supportedBy.description: Identifier of the company that has produced the item

supportedByImageUrl.description: Url of the image associated with the company that has produced the item

tenantId.description: Identifier of the tenant to which the item belongs. It forms a composite PK with itemId and, if present, version.name

type.description: Type of the item. It must match a CRD resources.name property

version.description: Version of the item following semver

name.description: Semantic version

security.description: Flag stating if the version addresses any vulnerability

allTenants.description: If true, the item will be accessible to all companies

public.description: If true, the item will be accessible from any user that access the Console, even if not authenticated

get.summary: Returns a list of all the Item Type Definitions the caller has permission to see
get.description: Returns a paginated list of all the Item Type Definitions the caller has permission to see (i.e., the ones available to all tenants and the private ones of tenants the user has permission to see)

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number to be retrieved

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: Number of items per page

parameters.name: displayName
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of case-sensitive display names to filter by

parameters.name: labels
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of Kubernetes-like [equality-based selectors](https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/labels/#equality-based-requirement)

parameters.name: maintainers
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of case-sensitive maintainer names to filter by

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of names to filter by

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of namespace IDs to filter by

parameters.name: publisher
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of case-sensitive publisher names to filter by

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: A string value used to perform a case-insensitive fuzzy regex search on the `metadata.name`, `metadata.displayName`, and `metadata.publisher.name` fields

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields for which the results should be sorted. Possible values are `name`, `displayName`, `publisher`. Default sort is ascending, for descending order add a "-" before the field

parameters.name: urn
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of URNs used to fetch a specific Item Type Definition, where the URN pattern is `urn:<metadata.namespace.id>:mktp:itd:<metadata.name>`. This query parameter will make the server **ignore any other filtering query parameter**

parameters.name: visibility
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of visibility values to filter by. Acceptable values are `console` (to target ITDs available to all tenants) and tenant IDs

head.summary: Returns a list of all the Item Type Definitions the caller has permission to see
head.description: Returns a paginated list of all the Item Type Definitions the caller has permission to see (i.e., the ones available to all tenants and the private ones of tenants the user has permission to see)

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number to be retrieved

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: Number of items per page

parameters.name: displayName
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of case-sensitive display names to filter by

parameters.name: labels
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of Kubernetes-like [equality-based selectors](https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/labels/#equality-based-requirement)

parameters.name: maintainers
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of case-sensitive maintainer names to filter by

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of names to filter by

parameters.name: namespace
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of namespace IDs to filter by

parameters.name: publisher
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of case-sensitive publisher names to filter by

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: A string value used to perform a case-insensitive fuzzy regex search on the `metadata.name`, `metadata.displayName`, and `metadata.publisher.name` fields

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields for which the results should be sorted. Possible values are `name`, `displayName`, `publisher`. Default sort is ascending, for descending order add a "-" before the field

parameters.name: urn
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of URNs used to fetch a specific Item Type Definition, where the URN pattern is `urn:<metadata.namespace.id>:mktp:itd:<metadata.name>`. This query parameter will make the server **ignore any other filtering query parameter**

parameters.name: visibility
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of visibility values to filter by. Acceptable values are `console` (to target ITDs available to all tenants) and tenant IDs

put.summary: Creates a new definition, or replaces an existing one
put.description: Creates or replaces an Item Type Definition. The match is tried against the resource compound primary key composed by `metadata.namespace.id` and `metadata.name`

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the tenant namespace of the Item Type Definition to create or replace (it will be matched against `body.metadata.namespace.id`)

409.description: Conflict between the `__v` passed in body and the one of the remote resource

schema.description: Conflict between the `__v` passed in body and the one of the remote resource

get.summary: Returns an Item Type Definition given its name, and tenant namespace
get.description: Retrieves a specific Item Type Definition identified by its compound primary key as path parameters (i.e., id of the tenant namespace, and name of the definition)

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the Item Type Definition to retrieve (it will be matched against `metadata.name`)

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the tenant namespace of the Item Type Definition to retrieve (it will be matched against `metadata.namespace.id`)

head.summary: Returns an Item Type Definition given its name, and tenant namespace
head.description: Retrieves a specific Item Type Definition identified by its compound primary key as path parameters (i.e., id of the tenant namespace, and name of the definition)

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the Item Type Definition to retrieve (it will be matched against `metadata.name`)

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the tenant namespace of the Item Type Definition to retrieve (it will be matched against `metadata.namespace.id`)

delete.summary: Deletes an Item Type Definition given its name, and tenant namespace
delete.description: Deletes a specific Item Type Definition identified by its compound primary key as path parameters (i.e., id of the tenant namespace, and name of the definition)

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the Item Type Definition to delete (it will be matched against `metadata.name`)

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the tenant namespace of the Item Type Definition to delete (it will be matched against `metadata.namespace.id`)

get.summary: Returns the list of available Marketplace items
get.description: Returns the list of available Marketplace items

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number to be retrieved

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: Number of items per page

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: Number of items per page. **Deprecated in favor of `perPage`**

parameters.name: availableTo
parameters.description: A comma-separated string of possible item visibilities: "public", "all-tenants", "private". It is mutually exclusive with "includeTenantId"

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: A comma-separated string of possible item categories

parameters.name: includeTenantId
parameters.description: The Id of the Tenant for which to return both the public and private marketplace resources. It is mutually exclusive with "availableTo"

parameters.name: itemUrns
parameters.description: List of item URNs used to fetch only specific items, where the URN pattern is `urn:<<tenantId>>:mktp:<<itemId>>`, or `urn:<<tenantId>>:mktp:<<itemId>>?=version=<<version>>`. Each list element should be passed on a different query param (ie. itemUrns=urn1&itemUrns=urn2)

parameters.name: lifecycleStatus
parameters.description: A comma-separated string of possible item release stages: "coming-soon", "draft", "published", "maintenance", "deprecated", "archived"

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Regex for filtering items by name

parameters.name: resolveResourcesData
parameters.description: If true the returned items contain also the resources data as well as metadata

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The field to which sort results. Default sort is ascending, for descending order add a "-" before the field (e.g. -name).

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: The Id of the Tenant for which to filter the marketplace resources

parameters.name: types
parameters.description: A comma separated string of marketplace Item Type Definition references. Each value may be a full Item Type Definition URN (following the pattern `urn:<itd.metadata.namespace.id>:mktp:itd:<itd.metadata.name>`), or a just an Item Type Definition name (i.e., `itd.metadata.name`) which will be considered belonging to the Mia-Platform default namespace

get.summary: Returns the versions of a Marketplace item
get.description: Returns the versions of a Marketplace item

head.summary: Returns the versions of a Marketplace item
head.description: Returns the versions of a Marketplace item

get.summary: Returns a specific version of a Marketplace item
get.description: Returns a specific version of a Marketplace item

head.summary: Returns a specific version of a Marketplace item
head.description: Returns a specific version of a Marketplace item

delete.summary: Deletes a specific version of a Marketplace item
delete.description: Deletes a specific version of a Marketplace item

X-Marketplace-Item-Latest-Version.description: URN of the new latest version

patch.summary: Patches the metadata of a specific version of a Marketplace item
patch.description: Patches the metadata of a specific version of a Marketplace item

annotations.description: An unstructured key value map that may be set by external tools to store and retrieve arbitrary metadata. They are not queryable and should be preserved when modifying this object.

categoryId.description: The unique identifier of this item's version's category.

description.description: A brief description of this item.

documentation.description: A reference to the documentation regarding this item.

url.description: The URL where to reach for the documentation.

imageUrl.description: The URL of the image associated with this item.

labels.description: A map of string keys and values that can be used to organize and categorize (scope and select) objects.

lifecycleStatus.description: The lifecycle status of this item.

url.description: The URL in standard URI format.

displayName.description: A user-friendly title for the link.

maintainers.description: A list of organizational entities maintaining this object.

name.description: The display name of the maintainer.

email.description: A contact email of the maintainer.

name.description: The human-readable title of this item.

providerId.description: The identifier of the provider used to retrieve markdown documentation content and external resources, if supported by the item's type.

relationships.description: A list of relationships from this item to any other entity (either part of the Software Catalog or not).

target.description: The receiving end of the relationships. It can be a URN-reference to another Software Catalog entity or an arbitrary string.

type.description: The type of the relationships. It can be one of the Software Catalog well-known relationships or an arbitrary string.

releaseDate.description: The time when this item was published.

repositoryUrl.description: The URL of the repository containing the source code of the resource(s) created by this item.

supportedBy.description: The identifier of the company that has produced this item.

supportedByImageUrl.description: The URL of the image associated with the company that has produced this item.

releaseNote.description: The release note of this version. It should support Markdown.

visibility.description: The visibility of this item. It can be public (i.e., visible to any user calling the APIs, even if not authenticated with the Console), "all tenants" (i.e., visible to all tenants of the Console installation), or private (i.e., only visible to the item's tenant).

allTenants.description: A flag stating whether this item's release should be visible to all tenants of the Console installation.

public.description: A flag stating whether this item's release should be visible to any user calling the APIs, even if not authenticated with the Console.

200.description: A single version of a Software Catalog item with required version.
